intro: Crocodilodes ecklonis, commonly known as the Cape rose, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmately compound leaves. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
